product_details.Deployment: Cloud, SaaS, Web, Mobile - Android Native, Mobile - iOS Native

about: The SAP Litmos learning platform enables thousands of global companies to deliver training in the now. The solution is comprised of a powerful LMS, a commerce platform, and a content-rich course catalog that make it easy to manage the entire learning program from system implementation and integration to ongoing administration. SAP Litmos empowers organizations to align corporate training with the companys most important strategic goals, while developing highly up-skilled workers who are more en

reactions.Comments:
We've been using Litmos for a little over a year, coming from another LMS system that did not meet our needs. Litmos is very easy to learn, we were building courses quickly once we got in. They have a great array of features for course building with different module types, including assessments, videos, text, and integrations with GoToTraining and other delivery tools that makes it easy to created a mixed deliverable which keeps people more engaged than slide after slide after slide. A for that.

They also update their product regularly with new features, and make it easy to learn/find these by notifications at the top of the site, and offering new release webinars and videos parked on YouTube. A on their communication of new features.

Reporting takes a bit of getting used to, as you can drill down from a broad set of figures to a granular individual student level, I often find it best to export these as Excel files and manipulate the data with my own formulas and pivot tables. B on reporting capabilities.

We use Litmos to train thousands of clients annually as opposed to training just a few hundred of our own staff - our DB at this point consists of 10,000 users and considering the volume, we very rarely have issues with the Litmos tool itself from an accessibility or bug perspective. As a professional trainer of software products, I can say confidently that that is a true accomplishment. A on code stability!

Best advice is to plan our your organizational needs as a flow chart so you get it right the first time.
reactions.Pros:
Integrations with many outside products, including GoToTraining/Webinar, Salesforce, Wordpress, several shopping cart tools, and more.

Easy to learn, easy to course build.

Several options for organizing by Team or Learning Path.

time.
reactions.Cons:
Two minor pet peeves in course building - no "center" option on image alignment - you have to either code it in, or put it in the middle of a 3 column centered table. No spell check in standard typing view, you have to go into the source code view to see spelling errors.

True con lately is support turn around time. Support is through online ticketing system, even if you call in, they simply file the ticket on your behalf. I understand the need for that, as we urge our own clients to use our self-service portals first. But we are currently in the position of needing assistance with the Litmos/Salesforce integration, and we are closing in on two weeks and still do not have resolution. I have twice proposed meeting times several days in the future and had team members on standby to drop what they are doing to meet with a Litmos rep when they have time for us, and both times got no response until after the proposed meeting dates. This needs serious improvement.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Take advantage of the trial site, load in as much course material as you can and play with multiple dummy account - you can get an excellent feel for the Litmos tool with that trial.

reactions.Comments: Litmos is by far the best LMS we have use. With it we can easily manage hundreds of users, track their progress, and create reports from their activity. The user interface is simple yet is feature packed on both the admin and learner side. The interface is customizable with custom theme colors, logos, and images, so we could completely re-brand it. We were looking for an LMS that could be sold through an eCommerce solution and they offer that as well as give the added functionality of allowing the usage of Shopify. We needed to be able to set up courses that needed to be taken in a strict order and they have a solution called "Learning Paths" just for that very need. The issues we had were minor and were alleviated by Litmos's support staff very quickly, usually the same day. The pricing is the best out of everything we looked at for the features and they were willing to negotiate prices beyond their standard pricing. There is built in testing/quizzing/survey authoring tools but you can pair you own authoring tools with it by uploading files to the system. We use SCORM compliant authoring tools and they are imported without any problems. We manage a few teams as well and Litmos accommodates this exceptionally well by allowing teams, or groups of users, to be bundled together. Overall, a great product that has a generous trial period so there is nothing to lose.
reactions.Pros: Very affordable, many features are included in low subscription levels which are great compared to the competitors, great support staff, easy to use, allows for many different file types to be imported, includes a good eCommerce solution as well as many plugins for external management.
reactions.Cons: If you need to move people between teams, there is no way to do so. You will need to create a new user in the destination with the same credentials and same course assignments, and then delete that user from the source. The interface customization requires a bit of CSS if you really want to go beyond simply modifying colors. The servers tend to struggle some with very large files if users are international as we received some complaints of excessive buffering from users in Japan. That was at the very extreme side and was to be expected.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Try Litmos. It has a generous trial period with access to all features and full support. If you need to be customized subscription models, contact Litmos and they will help you customize the LMS and pricing. You will be surprised with the amount and quality of the features of the LMS for the low price, compared to other providers.

reviews.title: Great product with some minor annoyances

reactions.Comments: We have used Litmos to fill our need for easily accessible on line training for our users across multiple counties.  It has improved our ability to not only manage regulatory and mandatory training, but to manage our staff compliance across the board for all of the positions within our Agency.
reactions.Pros: Litmos is both easy and fun to use!  In our industry, we work hard and deal with many intense situations on a daily basis.  Litmos allows us to offer fun and innovative ways to share information, collaborate with the Discussion forums and have fun with gamification.  If we have to learn, it should be fun, effective and  not add to the stress of our daily job.
reactions.Cons: I would love to see development regarding linking courses together.  For example, one online course serves as the initial foundation and is good for one year. After that, they take a refresher course that would satisfy the need for renewal.  Currently there is no way to do that. This is critical for our industry.  We also need a way to offer the initial course as an ILT, then apply an online course as the refresher.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Go for it.  It is a great option at a great price.  I've reviewed other LMS systems and this one is by far the best option for us and I would recommend it for anyone looking for an LMS solution.

reactions.Pros: With regards to the actual Learning Management System, the highly user-friendly interface allows me to be creative without the stress of a complicated application. The way modules are stored allows for reusing essential segments such as general course introductions and explanations. The seamless integration of other applications such as Articulate and Captivate is already impressive. However, being able to link my students to live presentations and actual sites for practical application provides more comprehensive accessibility. With regards to customer service, my concerns are addressed quickly. I feel that they care enough to consider my concerns even if they are not able to make adjustments at that time. Also, my students really like my certificates of completion, which are really easy to set up and change.
reactions.Cons: While this system is set up for eCommerce, it does not allow for the type of billing options that I want to offer my students. Additionally, the notice board is not easy to edit. I have had to retype my entire message. To address this, I develop my text in a word processor before copying and pasting it into the notice board. This has actually proved to be a better discipline for me, so I will probably continue this, even if they enhance the text editing capabilities.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Because the trial period is so short with evaluating this system, I recommend that the testers have time set aside to maximize this opportunity. Next, I suggest that a short sample course and a course with larger files are prepared using as many platforms as possible (including Powerpoint, video, etc.). Developers tend to forget that their users may be on tablets, etc. that do not handle large files so well. Next, s/he should solicit a few users who will be available for testing and immediate feedback. Having three people will better allow for seeing how to work with teams and how the course works in different environments. I also recommend that the tester get another test email address because the email address serves as the user ID.  All of this should be complete before signing up for the free trial.

reviews.title: Litmos LMS is Great for Integrated eLearning

reactions.Comments: We did a full 4 month research and vetting process to determine the best LMS for our needs, after more than legitimate 20 candidates of the hundreds to chose from we narrow the search to five and of them only one had the tools, feature and most importantly a vision for what the future looked like.
reactions.Pros: Easy build out and flexibility to use modules in multiple courses. Learning paths for course combinations make compliance training easy. However the two things that stand out a Pro 1) Customer Service/Support is over the top.  Every time we have had a question or something wasn't as we thought it should customer and support is amazingly fast in response time and thorough  in making sure we were back on track. 2) The reporting-you can build just about any report you can think of and trust me we have pushing the envelope.
reactions.Cons:
Hard to come up with a con that is exclusive to Litmos that other do better or offer. My biggest issue is with the pricing model of the industry as a whole, but it's still not a con since Litmos has more flexibility in their model to (kind of) meet our needs. 

I'm nit picking now but I wish we could turn off (hide) some of the fields in the registration page rather than just make them optional. As a company we already have the person information and data for the registrant so the page is unnecessarily messy. (I told you I was nit picking. )

reviews.title: Ahead of the curve in features, reporting and flexibility

reactions.Comments:
I worked with our department to research and test different LMS programs and Litmos was definitely our top choice. We are also working with a third party web developer who is implementing the more technical details of how the LMS works with our current website and he independently suggested Litmos after reviewing our list of possibilities. 

Litmos provided us the most features while still staying within our budget. We were most impressed by the user interface which was simple, modern, and easy to read while offering the most customizable options. However, customizing more than color options requires a good knowledge and understanding of web design. Creating and uploading course content is very simple and provides many options to create content within Litmos or upload your own SCORM content. There is no built-in E-Commerce option, but has a great integration with Shopify that would allow you to sell your courses if necessary. I wish there was a way to create notifications within the system. If you complete a course or gain an achievement, you have to browse through the different pages to find your results. 

Since we are still implementing the LMS, we have not been able to really experience all of the bugs that will inevitably show up, but for now it has been great. Our program is a little unique in how it's set up so we are facing some challenges in how to adapt the Litmos services, but they still provided the most options whereas other Learning Management Systems just did not have anything to offer.
reactions.Pros: Great customer service, informative yet simple interface, multiple integrations that work well.
reactions.Cons: Missing "Teacher" role that allows outside trainers to grade assignments without full admin access. Mobile app looks great but mobile website is lacking. You need a good understanding of HTML/CSS/Code if you want more customization than just color changes. Lack of notifications within the system.

reactions.Comments: I have been thankful to adopt the Litmos LMS with my job last year for many reasons. It is a user friendly platform and our ways of utilizing it are expanding. It's been great growing alongside Litmos. As new features develop, our company needs and ideas coincide almost perfectly. After attending the Litmos C3 Conference last year and learning a ton, I'm excited to see what's in store for this year and unveiling even more ways to utilize the program. My goal is to continue to see more use within our company for internal training purposes with multi-level users. Litmos is making that goal attainable as it expands, listens to feedback from existing customers, and supports users to see the potential in the platform!
reactions.Pros: Ability to upload documents, easy to read dashboard, mass management as well as personalized feedback options, account maintenance is easy especially password resets. Leaderboard offers friendly competition and incentive for users. Behind the scenes, it's easy to see where a user is experiencing difficulty or having trouble.
reactions.Cons: Integration to SF cannot copy emails or uploaded documents. Sometimes too many emails are sent to users overwhelming them when completing courses.  Some customer service reps and account managers are excellent, others do not follow through. Litmos Author information is misleading in terms of what features are possible through the program. Inconsistent limitations on uploading videos, etc., as well as sometimes "glitchy" processing of not saving users' answers, not opening presentations, etc.

reactions.Comments: We are a healthcare software company rapidly growing with needs to rapidly deploy education across our global employee network leveraging technology to avoid increases in head count.  We implemented Litmos without a hiccup and our employees are 100% engaged!  Our 90 day trending shows no end in sight to the benefits this incredibly easy to use technology will bring.  Every person we encounter at Litmos is devoted to our success.  A rare find in today's business world.  I highly recommend you take a look if education is at the forefront of your company objectives!
reactions.Pros: easy technology with seamless implementation, customization to your needs, reporting available for most anything you want to measure, can use all kinds of different mediums that are easy to upload and use, cost to value is more than other systems researched, best online help I've ever seen
reactions.Cons: would love to see more delineation in privileges allowing me to customize for my company's use and specific needs
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers:
1.  Try it, they provide it for free for a very reasonable time allowing you to try before you buy
2.  Make sure you know what you require and what is a showstopper in terms of features
3.  Integrations are important, check out the integrations available to make the most of your technology investment

Also, due to its integrations with other HR platforms, such as BambooHR, data sharing is much easier and helps make Litmos to excel where other platforms run into brick walls requiring either PS resources or a heavy investment of time learning the idiosyncracies of the software.
reactions.Pros:
Easy to use without a MIS or CS degree --  admin interface and extensive support  resources make every function easy to use and smooth to operate
Robust feature set --  load any content to create a course, run standard and ah-hoc reports, manage the talent pool -- if you need to do it as an LMS admin or learner Litmos makes it easy to use without IT support
Intuitive interface for users --  it's hard enough to get people into an elearning training, fighting the LMS interface shouldn't be a barrier in their way -- with Litmos anyone can navigate the platform thanks to an intuitive interface and clear context prompts
reactions.Cons: Relative to other platforms, Litmos is a solid and slick performer.  While there are other LMS out there that may be slicker to use, Litmos makes it easy to manage the content, the learners, and the data from one dashboard and I find the interface comprehensible from moment 1.  Their content is pretty generic and more focus on distinctive content would help them stand out.

TalentLMS has an unbeatable combination of price and features

reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Not at this moment in time.

reviews.title: TalentLMS has supported me to grow my business

name: Brightspace

product_details.Training: Documentation, Webinars, Live Online, In Person

about: From the kindergarten classroom, to college campuses, to global corporations, Brightspace helps create inspired and engaging learning for all. Our powerful and flexible learning management platform helps drive better learning outcomes by offering every learner a highly personalized, digital experience.

reactions.Pros:
As an administrator at my previous employer, I appreciated the flexibility to change pretty much anything that I wanted in the system. The ability to change what things were called in the system were very nice. In the most recent version that I had used, Brightspace had taken steps to make some changes on how system settings were handled to update the interface. Previously, the interface of the DOME was one of the most painful parts of the system.

I also appreciated the service desk that Brightspace has built up over the last three years. When I began using Brightspace, items could get lost very easily with the technical teams, but after some difficult issues, Brightspace has turned around a great deal, and updates to tickets were timely and applicable for a while before I stopped using it.
reactions.Cons: I found that there were little things that Brightspace did not do well. For instance, workflows between different tools were very different based on the time that the original tool was designed. This led to user frustration and an increase of time training users on the common functions of the LMS. I also found that Brightspace tended to minimize small updates or fixes in order to focus on major updates. While major updates are important to survive in the field, sometimes known bugs would remain for years without a fix.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers:
I have found that any LMS will introduce its own set of problems, and no single LMS will perfectly fit every single use case. Most LMS's will be able to fulfill the same basic sets of tasks: quizzing, assignment submission, and gradebook. I would suggest that you have end users try out multiple LMS products and look at which system fits your existing or ideal workflows best.

I would also recommend that you look at the flexibility of an LMS to fit your current academic or corporate ecosystem. This would include the ability of an LMS to integrate third-party software. No LMS can do both everything an LMS should (quizzing, assignments, gradebook, content distribution) and a lot of other things equally well, so you should look at the LTI extensibility as well as how well the LMS company works with other vendors and try to find out its reputation.

reviews.title: As a student, Brightspace/D2L gave me the opportunity to take classes I couldn't fit in my schedule!

reactions.Comments: I think this app is equally useful for both teachers and students. It is perfect for sharing files between users, it can keep people organized, and it also can provide with a high level of communication, as it has features that are not available in other platforms.
reactions.Pros: This app has everything students can use to avoid failing deadlines. It helps students to keep all critical data in one place, so it makes them more organized and aware of the education process. In Brightspace you can drag and drop all kind of files, as well as rearrange them, so new content can be easily seen. For teachers, it is also easy to create different types of tests or quizzes without spending much time or many resources. Brightspace is a well-known LMS and is used across our college as the learning management platform. It is used to distribute the different type of information, assignments tests, which makes the education process for both students and teachers more convenient.
reactions.Cons: This app lacks an intuitive interface. It is difficult to get used it, and it requires time to understand how to activate one feature or another. You need time to customize your interface; otherwise, it will be cluttered and even more complicated to use. There is an option to create discussions, but it is hard to organize them. It also would be nice to have a video chat option so that some lectures can be given online. Tech support can be improved, as it is not helpful and it usually blames users instead of fixing the problem.

reviews.title: Robust and diverse LMS for best results

reactions.Pros:
Brightspace puts a lot of options at the user's disposal. It is a powerful, robust LMS that can be customized to fit a wide variety of preferences. As an admin and as an instructor, I really appreciated that the system did not lock me in to one way of doing things.

I also really like how much, especially in recent years, the Brightspace development team seeks for input from its users (and provides great forums for sharing ideas for improvements).
reactions.Cons:
Currently, Brightspace does not have a very robust way of setting up communications throughout the course. They use a feature called "intelligent agents" for sending notices to students when they meet certain criteria (for example, sending a particular note to a student when he is inactive in the course or performs particularly well on an assessment). This feature, however, lacks a good deal of "intelligence" and is pretty restricted in what it can do.

I also feel that much of Brightspace is not particularly intuitive or streamlined. I'd like to see them improve on ease of use (without sacrificing power). A good example of this is the quiz feature where finding the exact page you need to get to in order to edit questions and grade values is a bit like a scavenger hunt.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Let your faculty and admins try out a number of different LMS's. Each LMS will have strengths and weaknesses and the question is which best fits the culture of your institution. In the world of LMS's, one size definitely does not fit all.

reviews.title: Brightspace: a powerful, but not the most intuitive LMS
I have used D2L almost daily for years and have never had an issue getting the info I need.

reactions.Comments: My students (middle and high school) are able to become proficient in the navigation of the system in just a few days with minimal questions and challenges.
reactions.Pros: BrightSpace includes all of the typical features of any LMS. However, D2L has improved the platform over time and has made the system more intuitive and user friendly. I also use CourseDen (the higher ed version of BrightSpace) for my college courses and the features are essentially the same with a few differences. However, the two platforms are enough alike that, once you know one system, learning to use the other one is a cinch. The features allow for very specific customization of assessments, discussions, and other features. I have built my own courses within the LMS, so I am familiar with a majority of the features and capabilities of the LMS.

reviews.title: Best Software for Universities to use!

reactions.Comments:
Possibilities for educators:
Communicate with students via email and online conference.
Accept online discussions.
Manage their grades.
Customize the appearance of the course pages.
Share the content of the lessons and the multimedia with the students.
They can comment.
Develop instructions and assignments in foreign languages.
Create instructions and assignments using a mathematical note.
Through its own builder that provides quizzes, multiplechoice, ruby and even games.
To incorporate portfolio-based activities into the work using the integrated ePortfolio system
reactions.Pros:
-It places the student at the center of learning.
-It provides collaboration and interaction.
-It has a variety of tools.
-It combines most learning theories.
-It can be used by both educators and trainees.
-It combines education and learning resources with assessment and analysis features to create an integrated e-learning environment.
reactions.Cons:
-The cost: It has an annual cost and is tailored to the number of users connected at the same time.
-It is not installed locally.
Course files are stored on a remote server that manages D2L.
-Network delay time is often slow and disturbing.

reviews.title: Brightspace: The flexible, cloud based, LMS. Created by D2L, 2014.
Brightspace was easy to learn as a student!
A platform for learning with its own learning curve

reactions.Pros:
I like that I've been able to do away with collecting paper in most of my courses. I am also able to easily arrange course materials for my students to access. Depending on your course, the original setup can be intense, but it is very easy to copy the course over for a new semester of a different section.

I enjoy being able to post grades and attendance in D2L. 

I love that I can grade a quiz by question. Sometimes, I need to only look at one question.
reactions.Cons:
There can be some misleading language such as "locked" on the calendar list next to a discussion assignment. Students see this as meaning that they cannot access the activity. But what it really means is that there is a period of time for which the assignment will be locked. It doesn't necessarily mean that the assignment can't be accessed at that time.  I get lots of questions about this.

I still find the grade calculating tool is not as robust as I need it to be.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers:
Consider how well it integrates with other technology tools that you use - (MyMathLab, Datatel, etc.)
Consider how well it performs on different platforms (pc, tablet, smart phone).

reactions.Pros: I took most of my master's level courses using this platform.  After learning to navigate it, I became very familiar with it, and it was a decent platform for the professors to present material on.  I liked how it would show notifications for discussion posts (particularly when someone would reply to something you had written).  Also, it would alert you when a professor had submitted a grade for an assignment.  These are great features that other learning platforms do not have, and I most definitely miss them when using those platforms.
reactions.Cons: It was not a very clean way to present material.  It was a little cumbersome at times, took a lot of "getting used to," and was missing some features that would have been helpful that I had experienced on other platforms.

reviews.title: The support has been great.  The tool itself is on par with others - not amazing but not bad at all.

reactions.Pros: Format, structure, and ease of use in navigating the site. I like how it is easy to drag and drop files, and if a mistake is made, to erase the file. I also like the Dropbox feature and how students receive a confirmation they have successfully uploaded a file. Though other faculty may have not liked the change, I very much like how you can move through student discussion posts to read their responses. The menu on the side allowing us to click on posts and to see which ones we haven't read yet is a big help. (Please do not change the discussion board.)
reactions.Cons: I do not really like the email client. I find it tough to easily search through email, though it is a minor complaint. I have most of my email forwarded to Outlook and use its search feature when needed.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Compare site organization and drag and drop features of D2L with your current LMS. I think the ease of use here will leave you wanting to switch from other products (especially Blackboard). Also use of Dropbox for loading student files is very easy.

reviews.title: I use D2L as my primary LMS for my courses both online and on campus.

reactions.Pros:
The customer support team is excellent, providing very helpful advice and bug fixes almost at a whim! Whenever we've had a problem, Brightspace were they almost instantly to lend a hand.
There are a huge list of features on offer, allowing for a wide variety of lessons and exercises be taught.
The session in-activity is incredibly useful, we use this in shared-classrooms where its not guaranteed that the user will log-out when finished.
reactions.Cons:
Not very easy to use, buttons and tools seem to be hidden away either within a menu or a seemingly random location.
Communicating with attendees via Brightspace is a pain, there isn't an easy way to send out bulk emails to students. There is some automated process here, but just sending out a basic text email to all students on a course would be very useful.

reviews.title: Feature rich, but not intuitive, LMS
Am I using all of the features?
Easy to use content and record keeping software for educational institutions.

reactions.Pros: Flexible and versatile.  Provides many basic features that facilitate the learning of students in our K-12 DL school.  Students and parents find it easy to use and teachers find it easy to provide quality content in their courses.
reactions.Cons: Difficult to get specific detailed help on specific issues particular to our K-12 organization.  Help to implement single sign on and Google integration to our Education Google Apps account seems difficult to get.

reviews.title: Satisfied but disappointed that some advance features cost so much more to impliment.

reactions.Pros: Course management overall is relatively easy. The ability to administer assessments that are timed or not, set different parameters for students. Dropbox for student's homework submissions is easy to work with, although I really wish I could specify filename for submissions when downloaded. The new numbers added to the front of the filename that I can't remove automatically is a real pain.
reactions.Cons: The new filename for Dropbox submissions that is not able to be changed is a real pain. I also don't like the additional assessment views that no longer work unless you specifically specify a minimum and maximum score. Attendance is not linked to the Seating Chart, so if I take attendance using chart, I must still put in the attendance in the attendance tool.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Overall this product meets my needs for course management. The company seems fairly receptive to feedback for new feature support.

reviews.title: Poor excuse for a modern LMS

reactions.Pros: I love BrightSpace. My old school switched from another LMS that did not have near as many features as BrightSpace. I was happy to learn that my new school also uses BrightSpace.
reactions.Cons: I cannot think of any cons about BrightSpace. However, starting a job at another school after using BrightSpace taught me that it is very important that it is set up right. My new school is not using many of the features that my old school uses. I think it is important to make sure that each school sets it up to make sure that students are able to get everything they can from it.

reactions.Pros: D2L is doing a great job of integrating modern technologies into their ILP (LMS). They are adding collaborative tools, video capturing tools, and multimedia interfaces very well. I've been an administrator of this LMS for about 3 years now and have been very impressed with the improvements each year.
reactions.Cons: It's hard to say. I guess with any technology, there are periodic problems. We felt like we were almost beta testers when we switched to 10.1, and we reported many bugs. I think also, the help desk folks are nice, but the turn-around time to get tickets resolved can linger onwards of a month or so.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: I think one must take into consideration how complex a learning management system is. It must accommodate student learning and be accessible through the world of changing web browsers, devices, and platforms. An LMS will always be adapting to the world around it and pushing the boundaries of academics.

reviews.title: Good experience with D2L as our ILP (LMS)
Brightspace is user friendly from a faculty perspective

reactions.Cons: From an instructor stand point it seems like there are some things that could improve. For example, the process of entering feedback with grades. At first, some of our instructors were entering feedback, but students couldn't find it. Um not sure if that was used errors or what.

reviews.title: D2L Brightspace makes it really easy for me to do my online classes!

reactions.Pros: I used this as both student and teacher as the university purchased it. It was easy to learn, use, and start with. from both sides. Teachers were able to customize a little bit. You are able to see students' last log in time.
reactions.Cons: Wish more students' activity tracking data being available.

reviews.title: Overall is good. But my unit switched to Canvas.

reactions.Pros: I really like being able to use restrictions to force students to do certain things before they are allowed to see other things. I think I will also like their adaptive learning--once they make it a part of their base system rather than an extra charge.
reactions.Cons: Improvements come at a cost. I believe that as they make improvements (for example, closed captioning) that they would include them in the price that we are already paying.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Be aware of the updates that are coming. When an update happens they all of a sudden have to use a different procedure to do something. When instructions have been added to all of your courses, minor changes become a major issue.

reviews.title: Flexible enough to meet the needs of all of our courses

reactions.Cons: I have not had any negative interactions using this online student portal.  I believe there was only one instance that brightspace was down because of a planned upgrade and they did a good job notifying their users ahead of time.

reviews.title: Beautiful tool for an online student

Great LMS Full of Dynamic Features

reactions.Pros: I like the ease of use for instructors and for students. It eliminates paper shuffling back and forth. Students/instructors can see grades at any time, including current average. It makes my job so much easier.
reactions.Cons: Mass editing of all tools is not always available to me. There are really only minor adjustments that could be made. Now I have to do this on an individual basis and this proves to be time-consuming.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: It's a great learning platform. It's easy to set up classes and easy for students to use. It makes my job so much easier.

reviews.title: All my classes are conducted through this platform.

reactions.Pros: I like that there are different tabs to maneuver throughout a course. You can very easily go from entering grades, to creating a new module, to entering attendance; it's very user-friendly.
reactions.Cons: I currently also work with Moodle, from a student perspective, through my own schooling. So in comparing the two platforms, while I like the ease of transitioning from one tab to another in D2L, honestly, I like the layout of Moodle a little better. I find that it's more comprehensive and just easier on the eyes. I like that you can write text and put pictures on the actual module, instead of having to create a document that a student needs to open.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: I think in order to give an honest recommendation a person would need to have experience with another platform. You don't really know what you don't like, or don't have until you see it somewhere else. reactions.Comments:
We use Brightspace to create and deliver our undergraduate and graduate level online courses. Overall, we've been pleased with the platform. As an admin and an instructor, I appreciate how flexible Brightspace is. I am able to customize my courses however I want to.

Brightspace is also good at seeking out user feedback to improve their product.
reactions.Pros: The LMS is very robust and flexible. It is also reliable.
reactions.Cons:
The interface is often not intuitive. Often multiple clicks are needed to find an important setting in an assessment. 

The communications piece ("intelligent agents") which allows the faculty to send automated emails when a student meets certain criteria (for example, sending a note to the student if they haven't logged into the course in 5 days) is quite limited and lacking in "intelligence."

reviews.title: A powerful LMS, but not always intuitive

reactions.Pros: This product is very user-friendly and very customizable. It's very intuitive to use. It has a great look and feel. They are always asking customers what we need to do our jobs better. Monthly updates come out to fix issues, create new tools, or revamp old tools.
reactions.Cons: This product comes with a nice price tag, but you pay for what to get. Most definitely worth the price.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Make sure you evaluate a bunch of vendors and rate them all on the same criteria that best meets the needs of your company and your clients. D2L Brightspace is hands down the best LMS/ILP on the market.

reactions.Pros: I use the content, news items, grade, attendance, and class list for e-mails the most. I like that I am able to post items students will need throughout the semester, stay in contact with them, and D2L allows personal responsibility for grades and attendance.
reactions.Cons: I wish that when using the e-mail-classlist - it would show the entire thread and also that it was compatible with MyMTC. It would be more user-friendly for both the students and faculty.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Pay attention because each box to be checked is important for the results you would like.

reactions.Pros: The support team is very fast in replying to any issues that may arise. Additionally they provide many webinars and conferences that help the users to create a network and exchange knowledge.
reactions.Cons: The not so intuitive construction of the LMS. Some navigation buttons can be confusing. One of the drawbacks is that it doesn't keep preferences like restrictions as default and you have to push lots of buttons or tick many boxes for each course.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Compare the product with other LMS and try it first as a student and as a faculty.

reviews.title: Brightspace by D2L is simple and customizable

reactions.Comments: Integrated learning platforms can be hit or miss but Brightspace is a big success for the average user.
reactions.Pros: Educational applications come in a variety of shapes and sizes, each promising to be a fully integrated learning platform but a number fall short. Brightspace provides an impressive array of options, each delivering a reliable experience. Brightspace is constantly looking to improve and seems to listen to feedback from users to make a more compete experience.
reactions.Cons: While the updates make a better product, they can be jarring at times, especially after one finds a sense of confidence in their normal routines with Brightspace. The interface dashboard can be a bit overwhelming at times, with button placement being oddly set up.

reviews.title: Brightspace is a Valuable Tool for Educators

reactions.Pros: Brightspace allows me to manage my classroom, department and adjunct faculty. It acts as a single repository for information that is vital to effective communication. Faculty and students alike can get what they need to be successful. Tech support is wonderful.
reactions.Cons: Downloaded material gets renamed with a number making it difficult to know who the assignments belong to.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: The more you use it the more valuable it becomes. You are able to be creative and provide many learning opportunities for your students and faculty.

reactions.Comments: What an easy platform to use. I have used 4 different ILP's over the years and I have to say this one has to be the best and easiest to use. Brightspace was very helpful when we had to convert from our old system to theirs. Out entire campus uses the product and we have been very please with the product.
reactions.Pros: Ease of use for faculty and students. Third-party platforms work well with the system and good apps available for faculty and students. Customer/Technical support is second to none. Every time I call I get a great technician on the phone who quickly addresses my needs.
reactions.Cons: Other than the system being a little pricey I really do not have anything negative to say. Overall good system.

reactions.Pros: It has improved some things, like being able to cut and paste into discussions.
reactions.Cons:
1. The layout is not clear to students. Many have problems locating things in the Content because they don't understand the structure. 

2.When I log in as a student and go to discussions, even when I have "grid view" and "threaded" selected, I don't really see a thread structure, just a list of messages. Since I teach literature, discussion is essential to the course, but this makes it almost impossible to use really well. 

3. When I'm logged in as myself and switch to "student" view, I don't see what the students see. I have to log out and log in as a different user to see that.

4.The grading and attendance features are not flexible and don't allow me to keep the kinds of records I need. 

5. The email is much too limited.

6. When I add a new topic to a module, I can't reorder the list of topics, but have to move the new one up one topic at a time. This takes a very long time.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: If they teach a subject like mine, I'd recommend that they investigate some other software, not D2L.

reactions.Pros: I like the integrations with 3rd party applications, relatively easy to use, and the fact that they're receptive to users requests.
reactions.Cons: We sometimes have to wait too long on support and usually get a response that a particular issue is a known bug. If they are known bugs, it would be good to be notified opposed to stumbling upon them.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: We use this in a higher education setting, so it was important to involve stakeholders from the beginning.

reactions.Pros: To be fair to D2L, the LMS has a nice look and feel about it (especially in the student facing view). Hence, students seem reasonably happy with D2L most times. They also seem to be able to navigate around the various tabs with some ease. Students DO have issues with the e-Portfolio feature which is far from intuitive and simply doesn't work at times.
reactions.Cons:
From the course creation standpoint, the software is very unintuitive and inconsistent. It appears that this LMS was created by a team of software engineers that did not commit to a consistent architecture. Hence, methods to accomplish certain tasks vary by where you may be in the LMS. This makes it very challenging and time consuming to use.

The discussion forum functionality is very dysfunctional and quite restricting. Many students have commented on how archaic this feature is and I agree with them.

The help function is virtually useless. One flounders until an answer is "discovered" or one gives up.

Finally, the number of clicks to accomplish the simplest of tasks is mind numbering.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: I would not consider this product under any circumstances. There are simply too many better alternatives available to consider D2L.

reviews.title: A professor's experience with Brightspace (D2L) LMS one year in!

reactions.Pros: The structure of the pages is visually appealing. It is easy to be consistent among your different classes.
reactions.Cons:
It is difficult to do some tasks that should be easy. (Example: When you forget to associate a test with a gradebook item, you have to come back and do that.  The test will not automatically populate to the gradebook.)

The mobile app is not good.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Sit down with someone who uses it daily and ask lots of questions.

reviews.title: Works great unless you are on a phone!

reviews.title: Difficult to use for adult students starting college

reactions.Pros: I love that all the course information can be located in one place. The ability to add videos and links to helpful information is important as we look for ways to make learning more accesible to students.
reactions.Cons: I have been using D2L Brightspace for several years and haven't found anything I don't like.

reviews.title: Good customer support compared with some other LMSs.

reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Compare it to other systems. It is as good as, if not better than all the other LMS systems.

reactions.Pros:
Nice look to the web pages as expected from any product.
There are many ways for students to view course content.
reactions.Cons:
The workflow to setup the class and create activities and assignments is completely illogical.  Managing the grades gets worse.
Dropbox folders, assignments are optionally associated with gradebook items.  Gradebook items don't show up as graded until a dropbox evaluation is 'published'.  Dropbox drill-down is cumbersome for the instructor in order to confirm or re-evaluate grades for individual students.
Constant slow total page-refresh any time simple changes are made.  Save buttons stay highlighted even if no changes have been made.
There is zero help except to send the frustrated instructor to a community page, with no contact available.

reactions.Pros: It is very easy to set up and maintain a course.  I really like that there are multiple means to complete tasks (i.e. upload course content, grade assignments/quizzes, contact students, change course structure).  To add, the availability of supports and video is phenomenal.  I was part of the Brightspace implementation team for our campus. The amount of time and effort put into making sure the product met the needs of the faculty and unique student body, and training of the first use faculty was quite impressive.  It is also helpful to have easy access to student progress and monitor learning out comes.
reactions.Cons: It is a bit difficult setting up the gradebook.  It is not impossible, but not easy.  Also, since it is required that one create a new rubric, it is time consuming.  It would be much easier if one could upload a rubric from another LMS (as is done with quiz content).
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Make sure you have time to learn the product before it goes live.

reactions.Pros: What I like best about Brightspace is they're willing to change to meet the needs of it's users.
reactions.Cons: The bugs that appear that make tools not work they way they used to and then resolve themselves later.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: I recommend not expecting all tools to work the same. Deleting something in an area, is not the same as another.

reactions.Comments: SNHU rolled this out over Christmas break 2017/2018 and provided a 30 min webinar for students. Although the webinar was instructive, the rollout seemed slightly different that the original student instructional. I read older articles and blog posts regarding the RFP that lead to BrightSpace and it didn't sound like the tech dept at SNHU was asking the right questions. I hear time and again how much the staff like it, but have yet to read how students were engaged in the process, which befuddles me.
reactions.Pros: Slick student facing design, seems to be many options for instructors to utilize the functions they're familar with, or those they find value for their courses but...
reactions.Cons:
Too many rabbit holes to go down, too many dead-ends that seem to not have tied ends. Not very intuitive, as a student, too many way to get an end result, resulting in a steeper learning curve and longer timeframe to develop a standard operating procedure. 
Instructors are asking me to finish previous weeks work, but failing to unlock the content so I can proceed because of their learning curve. Dislike the linked textbook content, and the ability for instructors to force the work, one way.

reactions.Pros: There are lots of good ways to use it. The upgrades seem to be responsive to what users need.
reactions.Cons: This is not particularly about Brightspace, but all LMS products seem a little clunky and sometimes not intuitive.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: In my opinion, Brightspace is a very clean and fairly clear and straightforward LMS.

name: Moodle

product_details.Deployment: Cloud, SaaS, Web, Installed - Mac, Installed - Windows, Mobile - Android Native, Mobile - iOS Native
product_details.Training: Documentation, Webinars, Live Online, In Person

about: Moodle is a free online learning management system, providing educators around the world with an open source solution for e-learning that is scalable, customisable and secure with the largest selection of activities available. Moodle is supported by an active network of certified Moodle Partners to assist with support and an active community of developers, users and supporters. For the latest version and features, visit Moodle at http://docs.moodle.org/en/Features

reviews.title: Flexible for designers, teachers and students
Moodle has been one of the best tools I have ever implemented in my high school courses!

reactions.Comments: There is not really any cons about Moodle. It is a highly satisfying product that is worth a try.
reactions.Pros:
First: It is free! 

As a student: it has easy navigation, provides a dashboard with all the related courses currently enrolled, it has a calendar on the right highlighting all the upcoming submission dates. It also notifies us about the upcoming events the lecture has set. All the information are arranged in a neat format. It shows the online users. It has portfolio option, makes it easy to keep track of all our works. It also has email facilities so we can email other users. 

As an administrator: There is so many features incorporated in Moodle! The teacher has the power to design the moodle course in however way they want: It integrates SCORM packages, documents, videos, links, quiz, different grading systems (average/individual) and the grade history of the students on the platform. The teacher also has the flexibility to program when to make one lesson visible (by presetting the time and date), when to close assignment submission past deadline automatically, or to create specific forums and events. One can use moodle to run a class or to act as a learning repertoire. There is also the option to add a chat room for a particular lesson. What I also appreciate is the feature to monitor course participation and activity log report of students. By including keys to the lessons, we can control who we give access to the contents on the forum. Thus it can either be open contents or private. The power lies in the hands of the administrator.
reactions.Cons: The chat feature should be an in-built feature rather than a pop-out screen available only when the administrator adds it as part of a lesson.

reviews.title: Moodle as a student and administrator

reactions.Pros:
There are lots and lots of resources for help. Almost every page on the Moodle site has a link at the bottom of it taking you to the specific documentation of what you are working with. Moodle has a huge community of worldwide users that are extremely responsive to user forums, so help is literally a couple of clicks away.

Moodle is easy to figure out, even if you have never used and LMS. The site I currently administrate is at http://classes.ala.org. As you land on the homepage, you will see the list of our different divisions who offer online courses. We do this using the categories feature, allowing each of our separate divisions to be represented on the single ALA site. What you might also notice is that the login for the site is a convenient eyebrow link. If you click it, there are a variety of options for setting up your own guest credentials in addition to signing in with your official credentials granted by one of the administrators. 

Most user issues are simple to troubleshoot. Moodle's no nonsense layout and intuitive interaction makes it pretty straightforward to figure out user issues. Error messages tell you specifically what a problem is in plain English (or whatever language you want to set up). Most user problems are rights related in the system.

Moodle allows you to restore previous courses into new courses. The backup and restore feature pretty much does everything for you. Take out the user data from a backup and you can restore the previous version of a course into a brand new course with very little downtime.
reactions.Cons:
Version 1.9 requires an older version of Java running in order to use the wysiwyg html editor (something that comes in handy for the introduction to the course and each section/Topic for the course) -- a version of Java is required, that if you are on Windows 7, has security issues that your Network Admin is probably blocking. 

The workaround not having an html editor is to open your web content editor (we have Drupal and Dreamweaver) and then paste the code into the setting fields. It is not difficult to do, just inconvenient. I am sure the current version 2.6 has this capability and more that we are waiting to upgrade to. 
You have to dig a bit to get to the settings and permissions for specific activities. For example, a common user issue is with Student access to a forum. It is not obvious that some forums are specifically for teacher announcements (meaning that students aren't able to respond, just read the announcements). By the time I get issue, the course creator has a dozen or so forums setup with participants already subscribed, which means that it is easier for me to go into each forum and override the native rights. When you have scores of courses running each containing a dozen or more forums that each need to have permissions touched, it is a lot of work from the admin point of view. The lighter side is that with the proper training, or sandbox playing, creators can discover this nuance before its' too late.
The native chat activity doesn't really work in version 1.9. We use FlashChat by Host123 when our course leaders need a course chat room.
In version 1.9, there is not a lot of wiggle room in changing the look and feel of the courses. You can add, subtract and move blocks around, you can assign a theme, but it is not the most modern look and feel.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: Moodle is a proven, solid Learning Management System that has early versions that are still operating today with very little struggle. It is easy to use and has a ton of documentation and support from its huge community of users all over the globe. I have worked with Moodle for over ten years, both leading courses as well as administrating for a group of twenty or so course creators.

reviews.title: Moodle LMS - Administrator and Trainer Point of View
My school has used Moodle for as long as I can remember, and it works well within our district!

reactions.Pros:
I have been supporting faculty and students for over four years on Moodle. One of the best features is the friendliness of the LMS environment. It is fairly easy to take an adult learner with minimal online experience from the login page to submitting assignments. The second aspect on my scale is usability. The LMS is simple enough to learn without a manual. To learn some of the advanced features may take sometime to discover unless you are utilizing the user guide and then it becomes a jumping point to enhance a course even more. Working and playing with the environment with a "seek and find" approach provides a great foundation for supporting various clients.

My institution uses the hosted environment, Moodlerooms. It is a great time and budget saver as we really cannot afford a full-time position and pay what should be paid to an individual and expect the environment to be up 99%+ and 24x7. One other advantage is planned updates every 6 months. Moodlerooms is typically one version behind which gives the Moodle community time to finish shaking out all the bugs.
reactions.Cons: The one thing I dislike about the vendor is the minimal number of add-in modules provided to the institutions. There are numerous add-ins out in the Moodle user world that could be an asset to our students but are not there because of the locked down environment provided by Moodlerooms.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: When evaluating any LMS, how well will it scale? What is your current usage and what do you expect in three years? What if you hit your three projection in 1 1/2 years or two? Can you support support the LMS with your current staffing or is a hosted environment more advantageous? And I think one of the basic set of questions would be, what LMS tools are absolutely essential, how many bells and whistles do you want or would like to have? And, if you should decide the change to a different LMS in three years, can your current content be archived and reused in a new environment?

reactions.Comments: Moodle is a very useful platform for e-learning. It has everything to teach online. I can recognize 3 levels of users for this software. - The administrator who is in charge to set up the environment and moodle experience for other users. - The teacher who is going to use tools to make an online course exciting, and - The student that will enjoy the course and participate in it though the collaborative tools. If you can do the work of the 2 first levels, congratulations, you are a Moodle expert.
reactions.Pros:
- You can manage a whole school or university in the academic area with Moodle and for the administrative help you have a big list of choices to get plugins or ERPs compatible with Moodle.
- If you know how to use it is a wonderful experience for the teachers and students.
- Once that you have the course online, it is a beautiful tool.
- There is a lot of documentation and forums about Moodle that can help you to solve almost every issue that you will face using it.
reactions.Cons:
- It's a free software but is difficult to install and maintain for a person who is not related with IT. So a good option is get it as a SaaS (software as a Service) paying for hosting and upgrades but having the experts doing it, so you can focus in the academic area.
- You have to learn how to use it properly and it takes time.
- Prepare a course is heavy and a hard work, there are some functionalities that could help us to do it easier, like be capable us to erase or move multiple objects at the same time.

reviews.title: One of the best applications for instructors.

reactions.Comments: It's hard to find something bad to say about this program. After all, you're getting so many features that other programs charge you to use. However, my experience with the lagging was frustrating, especially since I was on a deadline. If it had been only a little worse, I could have missed the deadline. Granted, while this was annoying, I have to remind myself that it is free to use. Can't really complain.
reactions.Pros: Well, first off, it's free! When price is important, especially for smaller schools and companies, free is always a good thing. The amount of features that Moodle has is one of the things that drew us to it in the first place. It has many features that even pay-to-use programs don't have. It's also so easy to use, which makes teaching new people how to use it a breeze. I like how grades can easily be uploaded and viewed. Courses are also very easy to update, with the ability to upload lecture notes, powerpoints, and tests. Very much worth the "cost."
reactions.Cons: The program is very basic UI-wise. It could do with a little more flair, user-wise. It would also be handy to customize the pages based on courses. It would also be good to have the program email a person when they receive a message. Otherwise, it could be days before you get a message, depending on how often you log in. Also, even though it is easy to use, it is often laggy. This is frustrating, especially if you're trying to complete a test or quiz by a certain time.

reactions.Comments: At my university, Moodle was considered a step up from the previous LMS software that had been used. Nevertheless, the general consensus about Moodle was lukewarm at best due to the software's lack of intuitiveness and its navigational issues. With some improvements in those areas, I think it could be a great, rather than a good, LMS option.
reactions.Pros: Pleasant and clean interface, allows for user customization up to a certain point, has many of the features and capabilities that you'd expect of an LMS software at the university level.
reactions.Cons: Moodle is definitely not the most intuitive software (although, I'm not sure that I could really say that about any of the LMS softwares I've used). The navigation menus in particular could be improved, as I often found it difficult to arrive at the page that I wanted to and consequently had to memorize the appropriate routes through the software's menus.

reviews.title: Good LMS with room for improvement
Great functionality at a great price

reactions.Comments: Like most LMS products, Moodle tends to assume that the course will be calendar driven rather than skills driven.  So while it is possible to create a course that is unit-based rather than tied to specific dates, the progression is still implied as linear.   It takes a lot of work to create a skills driven course with the opportunity for cyclical expansion of skills that build on each other.
reactions.Pros: Moodle is modular and flexible, meaning that it can be used for a wide variety of different types of learning.  It integrates well into joomla, allowing for customization of look and feel and organizational branding.  With the joomdle extension it also provides for seamless connection of payment information and membership profiles.  Basic features work "out of the box" - specific tools may require some programming knowledge to have them work exactly the way you want, but since it's open source, extending and adjusting functionality is unlimited.
reactions.Cons:
The "out of the box" version of moodle is not very attractive to look at - it could benefit a lot with a few less traditional themes. 
Support is from the developer community at large, so for "weird" problems, you may not get a lot of useful help.

reviews.title: Very customizable - technical expertise is needed

reactions.Comments: Moodle is an excellent choice if your organization is limiting itself to the consideration of open-source options.
reactions.Pros: As open source learning management systems (LMS) go, Moodle is the best, especially for higher education. It is highly customizable, includes a competitive variety of learning activities (paper submissions, discussion forums, quizzes/tests, wikis, etc.), and it supported and developed by a dedicated community of technologists and educators.
reactions.Cons: Moodle requires substantial developer work to implement, run, and update efficiently and effectively. Most smaller schools and colleges will find (as I did) that they need a third-party host, which will relieve that responsibility but significantly reduce the customization options and timeliness of updates.

reviews.title: Robust Open Source Learning Management System
It Works for What it Is

reactions.Pros: I have a deep appreciation for products that are free, especially a full featured product like Moodle that provides a high level of customization. I also like that it's a well established learning and course management system that is open source and includes a community of developers and users committed to improving the the tool. The help documentation and especially the forums have helped to solve nearly every issue I've stumbled upon in using Moodle. I also like that Moodle is constantly being updated to not just fix or improve, but to provide protection against security risks.
reactions.Cons: It's strength leads to its weakness. It's great to have a tool that is so customizable, but depending upon the level of customization you are interested in, it can be daunting and time consuming in figuring out all of the admin options and settings that are less commonly used.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: If you are considering using Moodle and you really want to make a lot of changes to the interface and are not comfortable working in code, I would suggest hiring someone with the following skills: html, css, sql, and php. I purchased a theme from theme forest, which saved me a lot of time, but I still had to go into the source code and make changes.

reviews.title: Moodle: It's Free, Great, and Customizable
The evolution of learning online, provided as open source.

reactions.Pros: It has a robust ability to deliver many different kinds of course content and smoothly and flexibly integrate and grade various kinds of assignments. The gradebook feature allows us to calculate grades just the way we need to.
reactions.Cons:
Changing settings within a course can be unwieldy, and there is a lag time every time a setting is changed, which makes making many changes in a work session fairly time consuming. 
When assignments are uploaded to a link in our LMS, confirmation emails and upload logs do not give the file name for each time-stamped upload, only the fact of the upload, making it difficult to tie different files to different upload details for the same assignment link.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: If there is something you wish Moodle could do for the organization or presentation or grading of a course, don't give up too soon. There are many, many settings that can be changed and customized. Not all of them are named intuitively, and sometimes you have to go to several different places to find the setting that needs to be changed to achieve your solution, but if you try a few things, often you can get it to do exactly what you need, even if it seemed unusual at first. Also, there are many, many plugins available that enhance it's capabilities even further.

reactions.Comments: Overall I think this is a great product that can use some refining to make it more intuitive for the next generation of student and teacher interaction.  Once I was able to get over the learning curve of the product and be able to trust that it is helpful for scheduling important dates it is a good supplementary tool for lessons.  It should by no means be used as a replacement for face to face participation.  The discussion board needs a lot of work, I would suggest a rating scale like readit or buzzfeeed but even that might be hard because of the small pool of participants.
reactions.Pros: The product is helpful for keeping track of work progress, submitting assignments, sharing resources, reviewing grades, messaging teachers and the features continue.  It has been a great platform to keep everything centralized and gain access to all of the class work that is populated by the professors. The customizable features are also helpful in regards to the potential of the software itself.
reactions.Cons: There are a few things that lengthen the learning curve of this tool and can hinder its effectiveness. One being that because it is so customizable, each professor uses it differently and that makes it harder for the student to know what is where when multiple professors are using it in different capacities.  Second is less crucial but can be annoying and that is the notifications don't always disappear after you have read a message.  Lastly is the point of customization, which I've also noted as a pro but as a con it can be difficult for discussion boards when the format to submit varies for posts.

reactions.Pros: Canvas is an excellent Learning Management System (LMS).  It provides multiple avenues to organize and present learning content.   The built in wiki-editor allows for html formatted pages. Most common document types can be imbedded and previewed.  Assignments, quizzes, and discussion come with many customizing options for access restrictions, grading.  Grading is straightforward and transparent.
reactions.Cons: There are some complexities and quirks that can trip people up--questions in quizzes can become unlinked from the version in the question banks resulting in multiple version of questions, and questions made in the quiz don't translate back to the original version of the question. Student's current score versus final score trips people up--missing assignments don't count against them in the current score which is what students see, but the final score is what is exported to student's permanent record.  Publishing items versus publishing the course in it's entirety
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: No Learning Management System is perfect, there are trade-offs.  Different products make different trades.  The instructor and developer interface remains relatively sleek, by streamlining the options available.  An LMS that could be customized to do everything everyone wanted it to would have to sacrifice ease of use.

reactions.Pros: After using other Learning Management Systems like WebCT, Blackboard, Desire2Learn, & eCollege, I have found that Canvas is better in almost every way.  Creating and changing content as well as linking to files can all be done by pointing and clicking.  Additionally, it is very easy to switch to HTML coding for advanced users.  I like that when I link a pdf document Canvas automatically gives the student the option to preview the document in the same page or open the document in a new browser tab or download load it to a pdf reader program.
reactions.Cons: I am very happy with Canvas, however some minor aspects could be improved.  The gradebook is very flexible and powerful.  It allows me to set grade categories (e.g., homework, quizzes, etc.) and assign grade weights to each category.  I can also drop the lowest assignment grades within a grade category.  My suggested improvement would be the way it drops the lowest grades.  It begins dropping immediately and this tends to confuse the students (e.g., "why was my perfect quiz grade dropped?").  It would be better if I could tell Canvas when to begin dropping grades.
reactions.Recommendations to other buyers: eCollege wasn't very good, but D2L and Blackboard are just fine.  I like Canvas better, but would be fine if I had to go back to using  D2L or Blackboard.

reactions.Cons: Sometimes that are glitches, it doesn't work consistently at all times, and it's compatible with some browsers more than others.  It's not easy to get customer support, however they do respond to emails.
